com.example.android.arrival.Util

Interface RequestCallbackListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DriverMapActivity, RequestTestActivity, RiderMapActivity

    public interface RequestCallbackListener
    Interface to be implemented by Activities that want to access information from Firebase through the RequestManager. Methods determine how to receive the data pulled from the database.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCallbackStart()
      Defines what should happen when the Firebase RequestManager starts to retrieve data from the database.
      void onGetDriverRequestsSuccess(com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot snapshot)
      Define what should happen when data is successfully retrieved using the RequestManger.getDriverRequests() methods from the database and how it should update.
      void onGetOpenSuccess(com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot snapshot)
      Define what should happen when data is successfully retrieved using the RequestManger.getOpenRequests() methods from the database and how it should update.
      void onGetRequestSuccess(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot snapshot)
      Define what should happen when a Request is successfully retrieved using the RequestManager.getOpenRequests() method from the db.
      void onGetRiderRequestsSuccess(com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot snapshot)
      Define what should happen when data is successfully retrieved using the RequestManger.getRiderRequests() methods from the database and how it should update.
      void update()
      Defines that the view should update.

    • Method Detail

      • onCallbackStart

        void onCallbackStart()
        Defines what should happen when the Firebase RequestManager starts to retrieve data from the database. For example, show a loading icon.

      • update

        void update()
        Defines that the view should update.

      • onGetRequestSuccess

        void onGetRequestSuccess(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot snapshot)
        Define what should happen when a Request is successfully retrieved using the RequestManager.getOpenRequests() method from the db.
